meanings.definition: Directed or turned upward or in an upward direction.
meanings.sent1: The bird had an upswept tail, pointing towards the sky.
meanings.sent2: Her upswept hair gave her a sophisticated look.
meanings.sent3: The upswept kite soared high in the sky, almost touching the clouds.
meanings.sent4: The upswept mountains seemed to reach for the heavens.
meanings.sent5: The upswept branches of the tree created a beautiful canopy above.

meanings.sent1: The dancer's upswept movements were graceful and elegant.
meanings.sent2: She admired the upswept design of the staircase.
meanings.sent3: The wind upswept the fallen leaves into a swirling dance.
meanings.sent4: Her upswept gaze caught the beauty of the sunset.
meanings.sent5: The artist captured the upswept waves in his painting with precision.

meanings.definition: Having an upward sweep or curve.
meanings.sent1: The car's upswept hood gave it a sleek and aerodynamic look.
meanings.sent2: The upswept wings of the plane helped it glide smoothly through the air.
meanings.sent3: The upswept smile on her face showed her joy and excitement.
meanings.sent4: The upswept lines of the building's architecture were modern and striking.
meanings.sent5: The upswept road led them to a breathtaking view at the top of the hill.
